page.title: 13Norham County First School
page.content: AGE RANGE 4-9yrs. 12 boys, 14 girls. Two full-time teachers. Norham school is one of the few village schools left in the country. Although the children are few- only 26- they enjoy a full and varied timetable, and the school itself plays an essential part in village life. Some children live within walking distance of school, others travel, via mini-bus, from farms within the 4 mile radius. Pre-school children attend a nursery class 3 half-days per week. The Parent/Teacher Association in this small village school is very active. Through-out the year it organises fund raising and educational evenings which not only provide valuable equipment for school but also establish a good working relationship between parents and teachers.
